name: State_10

timeline_beats.label: Proto-coastal chiefdoms consolidate into a maritime duchy
Expansion of shipyards and formal guild charters; treaty network begins
Participation in Great Naval War; loss and recalibration of maritime boundary
Entry into Maritime Trading League and Open-Seas Treaty; modern trade integration

factions.label: Harbormasters' Guild
factions.influence_hint: Controls port access, tariffs, and shipyard labor

factions.label: Maritime Nobility
factions.influence_hint: Holds coastal fortresses and naval command

factions.label: Saltworkers & Preservers' Syndicate
factions.influence_hint: Controls salt pans, fish preservation, and export quotas

factions.label: Augury Collegium
factions.influence_hint: Manages navigational auguries and ritual reagent imports

factions.label: Merchant Houses
factions.influence_hint: Directs long-distance trade and treaty negotiation

traits: oral navigation lore augmented by charts

constraints: No instant resurrection or true life-replacement magics
Long-range mind influence is rare and institutionally banned
Navigational auguries supplement, not replace charts or seamanship
Ritual magic consumes scarce imported reagents and specialized labor
Combustion-derived industry limited (no high-pressure steam megatechs)
Must observe interstate obligations under T1 and TB1 where applicable
notes: Strategic chokepoints: Outer Archipelago lanes and High Dunes Watch lighthouse.
Economic vulnerability: depends on imported reagents for augury and export markets for salted fish.
Harbormasters' Guild ties to Merchant Houses determine tariff flow; disruption risks civic unrest.
Naval militia tradition persists but professional navy shaped by Maritime Nobility and guild shipwrights.
Boundary sensitivities remain after BC2â€”ranked priority in negotiations with neighbors.
